definition: to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage

sentences.english: They chose a new pope, Benedict XVI.
sentences.chinese: 他們推選了一個新的教皇，本篤十六世。

sentences.english: The committee proposed (that) Mr. Day be elected.
sentences.chinese: 委員會建議推選戴先生。

sentences.english: Yesterday in the election of the monitor of the class, everybody elected Zhang Xiaoming.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我們選班長，大家一致推選張小明。

sentences.english: I put in three best students from my class for the English Speech Contest.
sentences.chinese: 我推選班上三名最好的學生參加英語演講比賽。

sentences.english: Kuwait the city was elected as the permanent headquarters of the OCA.
sentences.chinese: 科威特城被推選爲亞奧理事會永久性總部。

sentences.english: If they are not elected, Than Shwe grand plan is over.
sentences.chinese: 如果他們得不到推選，那麼丹瑞的重大計劃就會泡湯。

sentences.english: They re-elected him governor by a large number of votes.
sentences.chinese: 他們用大量的選票重新推選他出任地方長官。

sentences.english: Livni was elected leader of the ruling Kadima party last week.
sentences.chinese: 利夫尼上星期被推選爲執政的前進黨領袖。

sentences.english: Wead like to recommend our new home heasternativeh monitor.
sentences.chinese: 我們想推選我們新的家庭壯健監測器。

sentences.english: The workers made the young man vice-director of the factory.
sentences.chinese: 工人們推選這年輕人當副廠長。

sentences.english: The general in Korea is chosen by the Defence Minister and deputed into the Foreign Office.
sentences.chinese: 這位將軍被國防部長推選並被派到外交部工作。

sentences.english: She is elected as May Queen this year.
sentences.chinese: 她被推選爲今年的五月節女王。
1513年的今天，利奧十世被推選爲教皇。

sentences.english: The classmates wanted to make her the monitor,but she demurred.
sentences.chinese: 同班同學想推選她當班長，可是她不願意。

definition: the man (or woman) of the moment (idiom)/influential figure
to receive sb/to grant an interview
CPPCC (Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference)/abbr. of 中國人民政治協商會議|中国人民政治协商会议[Zhong1 guo2 Ren2 min2 Zheng4 zhi4 Xie2 shang1 Hui4 yi4]
